abstract: Publishing & Broadcasting, which is owned by James D. Packer, agreed to buy casinos in Canada for $1.2 billion.
snippet: Publishing & Broadcasting, which is owned by James D. Packer, agreed to buy casinos in Canada for $1.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Australia’s biggest gaming company, Publishing & Broadcasting, which is owned by James D. Packer, agreed today to buy casinos in Canada for 1.37 billion Canadian dollars, or $1.2 billion.

abstract: Australia’s biggest gaming company, Publishing & Broadcasting, which is owned by James D. Packer, agreed Wednesday to buy casinos in Canada for 1.37 billion Canadian dollars ($1.2 billion). Mr. Packer joined with the Macquarie Bank to buy Gateway Casinos Income Fund, a casino operator in western Canada, for 886 million Canadian dollars, Publishing & Broadcasting said. The venture also offered to buy two closely held casino management companies.
lead_paragraph: Australia’s biggest gaming company, Publishing & Broadcasting, which is owned by James D. Packer, agreed Wednesday to buy casinos in Canada for 1.37 billion Canadian dollars ($1.2 billion). Mr. Packer joined with the Macquarie Bank to buy Gateway Casinos Income Fund, a casino operator in western Canada, for 886 million Canadian dollars, Publishing & Broadcasting said. The venture also offered to buy two closely held casino management companies.

abstract: Closing a $52 million Series D round of financing, Boston’s Surface Logix has raised $20 million to help fund clinical development of its small molecule drug candidates. The round was fed by existing investors such as Venrock Associates, Arch Venture Partners, CW Group, HBM BioVentures, and Unilever Technology Partners.
lead_paragraph: Closing a $52 million Series D round of financing, Boston’s Surface Logix has raised $20 million to help fund clinical development of its small molecule drug candidates. The round was fed by existing investors such as Venrock Associates, Arch Venture Partners, CW Group, HBM BioVentures, and Unilever Technology Partners.

headline.main: Surface Logix Gets $20 Million in Series D Round
